Interface Batcher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VAOBatcher

    public interface Batcher
    An abstraction for batchers.
    Author:
    wessles

      • vertex

        void vertex(float x,
          float y,
          float r,
          float g,
          float b,
          float u,
          float v)
        Adds a vertex to the stack.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position.
        y - The y position.
        r - The red value of color of the vertex.
        g - The green value of color of the vertex.
        b - The blue value of color of the vertex.
        u - The x texture coordinate.
        v - The y texture coordinate.

      • vertex

        void vertex(float x,
          float y,
          float r,
          float g,
          float b,
          float a,
          float u,
          float v)
        Adds a vertex to the stack.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position.
        y - The y position.
        r - The red value of color of the vertex.
        g - The green value of color of the vertex.
        b - The blue value of color of the vertex.
        a - The alpha value of color of the vertex.
        u - The x texture coordinate.
        v - The y texture coordinate.

      • flushIfOverflow

        void flushIfOverflow(int allocate)
        Will flush the data to OGL if the sum of the vertex count and the allocation is higher than the limit.
        Parameters:
        allocate - The amount of vertices that will be rendered in the next vertex-group.

      • getVerticesLastRendered

        int getVerticesLastRendered()
        Returns:
        The amount of vertices rendered last render frame.
